timeline.bodyText: super nit: Do you think it's worth adding an UnsupportedQueryException class that other parts of the query stack can re-use for query operations that are unsupported? I don't know of any of these places of the top of my head, so feel free to ignore this comment. I think this is ok for now.
timeline.author: suneet-s

replies.bodyText: I think it'll be useful. Added

timeline.bodyText:
I think this limitation is implied from the above limitation. Slight grammar re-wording if you want to keep the warning.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - JOIN containing constant value inside the condition
          
          
            
            - JOIN conditions containing a constant value inside the condition.
timeline.author: suneet-s
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -709,6 +709,8 @@ Druid does not support all SQL features. In particular, the following features a
 
 - JOIN between native datasources (table, lookup, subquery) and system tables.
 - JOIN conditions that are not an equality between expressions from the left- and right-hand sides.
+- JOIN containing constant value inside the condition

replies.bodyText: Just to be explicit since the mentioning of "expressions" on the above limitation may be missed.
replies.author: maytasm

            - JOIN conditions on a column which contains a multi-value dimension.

timeline.bodyText:
javadocs please. Details about who should use this and when; may be helpful to future devs.
I think the key fact here is that this error message will be propagated back to the user. Providing guidance on using this error vs a ISE or RE for example would be useful.

timeline.bodyText: Do you think we should provide the host as part of the exception? For cases where an issue only happens on a subset of segments (for example: a multi-value dimension is only present in a segment on host abc) this would be very helpful debugging information.

+  {

timeline.bodyText:
nit:since this error message is user facing - do you think we should modify the constructor take in an error code, and generate the message in this class?
That would make it less error prone for another dev to pass in sensitive information as part of the error message.
This suggestion might be over-engineering. Feel free to ignore.

+import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;

replies.bodyText: I feel like keeping an error code to error message mapping will be a pain. There is not a well define set of error code. We can have an unbound number of query type / query feature we don't support. This list would always go up (as we add more functionality) and down (as we fix / iterate). The errorMessage should just indicate what feature exactly is not supported.
replies.author: maytasm

+/**

+ * following reasons: 1) The query is not supported yet. 2) The query is not something Druid would ever supports.
